comments.body: `coursier fetch org.scalameta:scalameta_2.12:3.3.0 -r sonatype:releases` should work right after `sonatypeReleaseAll` completes. Remove `-r sonatype:releases` to validate if the artifacts are on maven central. In the fastparse repo I actually have script to automatically validate that all entries in the release matrix got released.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +47,51 @@  * Wait for up to several hours (for 3.2.0, we waited for 15 minutes;
    for 3.3.0, we waited for 1.5 hours).
  * Make sure that the release shows up at https://search.maven.org/#search%7Cga%7C1%7Corg.scalameta%20a%3A%22scalameta_2.12%22.
  * If it's been a while, and the release doesn't show up at Maven Central,
    ping Sonatype at [OSSRH-10192](https://issues.sonatype.org/browse/OSSRH-10192).

comments.body:
Alternatively, `sbt sonatypeReleaseAll` from the scalameta build.

I would love to get rid of this step by adding a build stage that does this step after all release jobs complete.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +12,16 @@* Wait for [the Travis CI job](https://travis-ci.org/scalameta/scalameta/branches)
   in Active Branches to build the binaries and stage them to Sonatype.
* Finalize the release on Sonatype:
  * `sbt sonatypeReleaseAll`
  * Alternatively:
